headline.print_headline: French Lawmakers OK Health Care Bill Targeting Anorexia
headline.main: French Lawmakers OK Health Care Bill Targeting Anorexia

docs.lead_paragraph: Too-thin models, too much drinking, sexy cigarette packs: France's parliament is cracking down on all of these in a sweeping bill designed to improve public health and trim public health costs — while tackling unhealthy stereotypes along the way.
docs.snippet: Too-thin models, too much drinking, sexy cigarette packs: France's parliament is cracking down on all of these in a sweeping bill designed to improve public health and trim public health costs — while tackling unhealthy stereotypes along the...

headline.print_headline: New York Lawmakers Mull Warning Labels on Sugary Beverages
headline.main: New York Lawmakers Mull Warning Labels on Sugary Beverages

docs.lead_paragraph: Public health advocates urged New York state lawmakers Monday to require labels on sugary drinks to warn consumers about the dangers of obesity, diabetes and tooth decay.
docs.snippet: Public health advocates urged New York state lawmakers Monday to require labels on sugary drinks to warn consumers about the dangers of obesity, diabetes and tooth decay.

headline.print_headline: Workplace Workouts Can Snag on Stressful Corporate Culture
headline.main: Workplace Workouts Can Snag on Stressful Corporate Culture

docs.lead_paragraph: As evidence mounts that fit employees are productive workers, companies have slotted into the corporate routine an array of workplace workout initiatives, from in-house gyms to lunchtime yoga.
docs.snippet: As evidence mounts that fit employees are productive workers, companies have slotted into the corporate routine an array of workplace workout initiatives, from in-house gyms to lunchtime yoga.

headline.print_headline: In Pursuit of a Wily, Elusive, Tasty Adversary
headline.main: Hooking a Slippery Prize Where the Klamath River Meets the Pacific

docs.abstract: Male members of Yurok Indian tribe are engaged in annual spring tradition of fishing for Pacific lampreys at mouth of Klamath River in northern California; lampreys, which are referred to colloquially as eels, are much-prized traditional foodstuff, and fishing is challenging and sometimes dangerous work.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pacific lampreys, which are similar to eels, are a traditional food source and piscatorial obsession for members of the Yurok Tribe in Northern California.
docs.snippet: Pacific lampreys, which are similar to eels, are a traditional food source and piscatorial obsession for members of the Yurok Tribe in Northern California.

headline.print_headline: Cancer Surge in China Prompts Rise of Special Patient Hotels
headline.main: Cancer Surge in China Prompts Rise of Special Patient Hotels

docs.lead_paragraph: Li Xiaohe has set herself up for the long haul in a cramped but sunny room in western Beijing, about a block from China's most renowned cancer hospital. Her laundry dries on hangers and her husband cooks in a communal kitchen as she embarks on an 84-day program of chemotherapy, following the removal of part of her right breast.

headline.print_headline: Shorter Stature May Increase Risk of Heart Disease
headline.main: Shorter Stature May Pose Higher Risk of Heart Disease

docs.abstract: Sir Nilesh Samani study in New England Journal of Medicine concludes that shorter stature increases risk of heart disease, with each additional 2.5 inches of height bringing 13.5 reduction in heart disease risk; surprising finding may lead to discovery of new links to heart disease.
docs.lead_paragraph: After gathering genetic data from nearly 200,000 people worldwide, researchers found that each extra 2.5 inches of height brings a 13.5 percent reduction in heart disease risk.
docs.snippet: After gathering genetic data from nearly 200,000 people worldwide, researchers found that each extra 2.5 inches of height brings a 13.5 percent reduction in heart disease risk.
